javadoc: DBBuffer facilitates synchronized access to a ChainedBuffer.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: dbh
params.comment: database handle (public methods are synchronized on this object).

params.name: buf
params.comment: chained buffer which is associated with the specified dbh.

methods.name: split
methods.comment:
Split this DBBuffer object into two seperate DBBuffers.  This DBBuffer remains
 valid but its new size is equal offset.  The newly created DBBuffer is 
 returned.

params.name: offset
params.comment:
the split point.  The byte at this offset becomes the first
 byte within the new buffer.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.name: setSize
methods.comment: Set the new size for this DBBuffer object.

params.name: size
params.comment: new size

params.name: preserveData
params.comment:
if true, existing data is preserved at the original offsets.  If false,
 no additional effort will be expended to preserve data.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs.

methods.javadoc:
Get the first buffer ID associated with this chained buffer.  This DBBuffer
 may be reinstatiated using the returned buffer ID provided subsequent changes 
 are not made.
@return buffer ID
methods.name: getId
methods.comment:
Get the first buffer ID associated with this chained buffer.  This DBBuffer
 may be reinstatiated using the returned buffer ID provided subsequent changes 
 are not made.

methods.name: fill
methods.comment: Fill the buffer over the specified range with a byte value.

params.name: startOffset
params.comment: starting offset, inclusive

params.name: endOffset
params.comment: ending offset, exclusive

params.name: fillByte
params.comment: byte value

methods.name: append
methods.comment:
Append the contents of the specified dbBuf onto the end of this buffer.
 The size of this buffer increases by the size of dbBuf.  When the operation 
 is complete, dbBuf object is no longer valid and must not be used.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.name: getByte
methods.comment: Get the 8-bit byte value located at the specified offset.

params.name: offset
params.comment: byte offset from start of buffer.

throws.comment:
is thrown if an error occurs while accessing the
 underlying storage.

return.comment: the byte value at the specified offset.

methods.name: get
methods.comment:
Get the byte data located at the specified offset and store into the data
 array  at the specified data offset.

params.name: offset
params.comment: byte offset from the start of the buffer.

params.name: data
params.comment: byte array to store the data.

params.name: dataOffset
params.comment: offset into the data buffer

params.name: length
params.comment: amount of data to read

throws.comment:
is thrown if an error occurs while accessing the
 underlying storage.

methods.name: fill
methods.comment:
Fill buffer with data provided by InputStream.  If 
 stream is exhausted, the remainder of the buffer will be filled
 with 0's.

params.name: in
params.comment: data source

methods.name: put
methods.comment:
Put a specified number of bytes from the array provided into the buffer
 at the specified offset.  The number of bytes stored is specified by the
 length specified.

params.name: offset
params.comment: byte offset from start of buffer.

params.name: dataOffset
params.comment: the starting offset into the data.

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of bytes to be stored.

throws.comment:
is thrown if an error occurs while accessing the
 underlying storage.

return.comment:
the next available offset into the buffer, or -1 if the buffer is
 full.

methods.name: put
methods.comment:
Put the bytes provided into the buffer at the specified offset. The
 number of bytes stored is determined by the length of the bytes
 array.

params.name: offset
params.comment: byte offset from start of buffer.

params.name: bytes
params.comment: the byte data to be stored.

throws.comment:
is thrown if an error occurs while accessing the
 underlying storage.

return.comment:
the next available offset into the buffer, or -1 if the buffer is
 full.

methods.name: putByte
methods.comment: Put the 8-bit byte value into the buffer at the specified offset.

params.name: offset
params.comment: byte offset from start of buffer.

params.name: b
params.comment: the byte value to be stored.

throws.comment:
is thrown if an error occurs while accessing the
 underlying storage.

return.comment:
the next available offset into the buffer, or -1 if the buffer is
 full.

methods.name: get
methods.comment: Get the byte data located at the specified offset.

params.name: offset
params.comment: byte offset from start of buffer.

throws.comment:
is thrown if an error occurs while accessing the
 underlying storage.

methods.javadoc: Delete and release all underlying DataBuffers.
methods.name: delete
methods.comment: Delete and release all underlying DataBuffers.

name: DBBuffer
comment: DBBuffer facilitates synchronized access to a ChainedBuffer.
